001package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.cielab;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.*;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
008import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2;
009import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
010import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Matrix4;
011import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.NumberUtils;
012
013import java.nio.Buffer;
014
015/**
016 * A substitute for {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch} that adds an additional attribute to store an
017 * extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the L, A, and B channels of a color by multiplication (called the
018 * "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from
019 * {@link Palette} or generated with {@link ColorTools}). This ColorfulBatch uses the CIELAB color space where
020 * SpriteBatch normally uses RGBA, which means that in the batch color, red maps to additive L (lightness), green maps
021 * to additive A (green-to-red), blue maps to additive B (violet-to-yellow), and alpha continues to be multiplicative
022 * alpha. Additive values cause no change when they are 0.5, but cause a sharp increase at 1.0 and a sharp decrease at
023 * 0.0. In the tweak, red maps to multiplicative L, green maps to multiplicative A, blue maps to multiplicative B, and
024 * alpha maps to "exponential-like" contrast. Like with the additive values, 0.5 causes no change for multiplicative
025 * values, but you can think of the existing color as being temporarily shifted down by 0.5 for each of the LAB
026 * channels, so each LAB channel's range is -0.5 to 0.5 before being multiplied by the corresponding tweak value (times
027 * 2.0, which means multiplicative tweak values for A and B that are less than 0.5 make colors closer to grayscale and
028 * values greater than 0.5 make colors more vibrant) and then shifted back to its prior range. Contrast is a special
029 * value; 0.5 still means "no change," but lower values will make L changes less distinct between similar colors, while
030 * higher values will "sharpen" the changes in L.
031 * <br>
032 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 1/21/2021.
033 */
034public class ColorfulBatch implements Batch {
035    public static final int SPRITE_SIZE = 24;
036    public static final String TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE = "a_tweak";
037
038    private Mesh mesh;
039
040    private final float[] vertices;
041    private int idx = 0;
042    private Texture lastTexture = null;
043    private float invTexWidth = 0, invTexHeight = 0;
044
045    private boolean drawing = false;
046
047    private final Matrix4 transformMatrix = new Matrix4();
048    private final Matrix4 projectionMatrix = new Matrix4();
049    private final Matrix4 combinedMatrix = new Matrix4();
050
051    private boolean blendingDisabled = false;
052    private int blendSrcFunc = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
053    private int blendDstFunc = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
054    private int blendSrcFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
055    private int blendDstFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
056
057    private final ShaderProgram shader;
058    private ShaderProgram customShader = null;
059    private boolean ownsShader;
060
061    protected float color = Palette.GRAY;
062    private final Color tempColor = new Color(0.5372549f, 0.49411765f, 0.49019608f, 1f); // LAB from Palette.GRAY
063
064    /**
065     * A constant packed float that can be assigned to this ColorfulBatch's tweak with {@link #setTweak(float)} to make
066     * all of the tweak adjustments virtually imperceptible. When this is set as the tweak, it won't change the
067     * L multiplier or contrast, and it won't change the A multiplier or the B multiplier.
068     */
069    public static final float TWEAK_RESET = ColorTools.cielab(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f);
070    protected float tweak = TWEAK_RESET;
071
072    /** Number of render calls since the last {@link #begin()}. **/
073    public int renderCalls = 0;
074
075    /** Number of rendering calls, ever. Will not be reset unless set manually. **/
076    public int totalRenderCalls = 0;
077
078    /** The maximum number of sprites rendered in one batch so far. **/
079    public int maxSpritesInBatch = 0;
080
081    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch with a size of 1000, one buffer, and the default shader.
082     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram) */
083    public ColorfulBatch() {
084        this(1000, null);
085    }
086
087    /** Constructs a ColorfulBatch with one buffer and the default shader.
088     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram)  */
089    public ColorfulBatch(int size) {
090        this(size, null);
091    }
092
093    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch. Sets the projection matrix to an orthographic projection with y-axis point upwards, x-axis
094     * point to the right and the origin being in the bottom left corner of the screen. The projection will be pixel perfect with
095     * respect to the current screen resolution.
096     * <p>
097     * The defaultShader specifies the shader to use. Note that the names for uniforms for this default shader are different than
098     * the ones expect for shaders set with {@link #setShader(ShaderProgram)}. See {@link #createDefaultShader()}.
099     * @param size The max number of sprites in a single batch. Max of 10922.
100     * @param defaultShader The default shader to use. This is not owned by the ColorfulBatch and must be disposed separately. */
101    public ColorfulBatch(int size, ShaderProgram defaultShader) {
102        // 65535 is max vertex index, so 65535 / 6 vertices per sprite = 10922 sprites max.
103        if (size > 10922) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't have more than 10922 sprites per batch: " + size);
104
105        Mesh.VertexDataType vertexDataType = (Gdx.gl30 != null) ? Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexBufferObjectWithVAO : Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexArray;
106
107        mesh = new Mesh(vertexDataType, false, size * 4, size * 6,
108                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.Position, 2, ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE),
109                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE),
110                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.TextureCoordinates, 2, ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0"),
111                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE));
112
113        projectionMatrix.setToOrtho2D(0, 0, Gdx.graphics.getWidth(), Gdx.graphics.getHeight());
114
115        vertices = new float[size * SPRITE_SIZE];
116
117        int len = size * 6;
118        short[] indices = new short[len];
119        short j = 0;
120        for (int i = 0; i < len; i += 6, j += 4) {
121            indices[i] = j;
122            indices[i + 1] = (short)(j + 1);
123            indices[i + 2] = (short)(j + 2);
124            indices[i + 3] = (short)(j + 2);
125            indices[i + 4] = (short)(j + 3);
126            indices[i + 5] = j;
127        }
128        mesh.setIndices(indices);
129
130        if (defaultShader == null) {
131            shader = createDefaultShader();
132            ownsShader = true;
133        } else
134            shader = defaultShader;
135    }
136
137    /**
138     * Makes a new instance of the default ShaderProgram used for this ColorfulBatch, without any {@code #version}
139     * specified in the shader source. This expects an extra attribute (relative to a normal SpriteBatch) that is used
140     * for the tweak. You may want to set the code to prepend before you call this, as with:
141     * {@code ShaderProgram.prependVertexCode = "#version 110\n";
142     * ShaderProgram.prependFragmentCode = "#version 110\n";}
143     * The actual version can be different, and may need to be different for compatibility with some hardware.
144     * @return a new instance of the default shader used by ColorfulBatch for GL2 when no shader is specified
145     */
146    public static ShaderProgram createDefaultShader () {
147        String vertexShader = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
148                + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
149                + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
150                + "attribute vec4 " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
151                + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
152                + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
153                + "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n"
154                + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
155                + "varying float v_lightFix;\n"
156                + "\n"
157                + "void main()\n"
158                + "{\n"
159                + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
160                + "   v_color.w = v_color.w * (255.0/254.0);\n"
161                + "   v_tweak = " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
162                + "   v_tweak.w = pow(v_tweak.w * (255.0/254.0) + 0.5, 1.709);\n"
163                + "   v_lightFix = 1.0 + pow(v_tweak.w, 1.41421356);\n"
164                + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
165                + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
166                + "}\n";
167        String fragmentShader =
168                "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
169                        "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
170                        "precision mediump float;\n" +
171                        "#else\n" +
172                        "#define LOWP \n" +
173                        "#endif\n" +
174                        "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
175                        "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
176                        "varying LOWP vec4 v_tweak;\n" +
177                        "varying float v_lightFix;\n" +
178                        "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
179                        "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
180                        "const vec3 sRGBFrom = vec3(2.4);\n" +
181                        "const vec3 sRGBThresholdFrom = vec3(0.04045);\n" +
182                        "const vec3 sRGBTo = vec3(1.0 / 2.4);\n" +
183                        "const vec3 sRGBThresholdTo = vec3(0.0031308);\n" +
184                        "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.00885645);\n" +
185                        "vec3 linear(vec3 t){ return mix(pow((t + 0.055) * (1.0 / 1.055), sRGBFrom), t * (1.0/12.92), step(t, sRGBThresholdFrom)); }\n" +
186                        "vec3 sRGB(vec3 t){ return mix(1.055 * pow(t, sRGBTo) - 0.055, 12.92*t, step(t, sRGBThresholdTo)); }\n" +
187                        "float xyzF(float t){ return mix(pow(t,1./3.), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, 0.00885645)); }\n" +
188                        "vec3 xyzF(vec3 t){ return mix(pow(t, forward), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon)); }\n" +
189                        "float xyzR(float t){ return mix(t*t*t , 0.1284185 * (t - 0.139731), step(t, 0.20689655)); }\n" +
190                        "vec3 rgb2lab(vec3 c)\n" +
191                        "{\n" +
192                        "    c *= mat3(0.4124, 0.3576, 0.1805,\n" +
193                        "              0.2126, 0.7152, 0.0722,\n" +
194                        "              0.0193, 0.1192, 0.9505);\n" +
195                        "    c = xyzF(c);\n" +
196                        "    vec3 lab = vec3(max(0.,1.16*c.y - 0.16), (c.x - c.y) * 5.0, (c.y - c.z) * 2.0); \n" +
197                        "    return lab;\n" +
198                        "}\n" +
199                        "vec3 lab2rgb(vec3 c)\n" +
200                        "{\n" +
201                        "    float lg = 1./1.16*(c.x + 0.16);\n" +
202                        "    vec3 xyz = vec3(xyzR(lg + c.y * 0.2),\n" +
203                        "                    xyzR(lg),\n" +
204                        "                    xyzR(lg - c.z * 0.5));\n" +
205                        "    vec3 rgb = xyz*mat3( 3.2406, -1.5372,-0.4986,\n" +
206                        "                        -0.9689,  1.8758, 0.0415,\n" +
207                        "                         0.0557, -0.2040, 1.0570);\n" +
208                        "    return rgb;\n" +
209                        "}\n" +
210                        "void main()\n" +
211                        "{\n" +
212                        "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
213                        "  vec3 lab = rgb2lab(linear(tgt.rgb));\n" +
214                        "  lab.x = clamp(pow(lab.x, v_tweak.w) * v_lightFix * v_tweak.x + v_color.x - 0.5372549, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
215                        "  lab.yz = (lab.yz * v_tweak.yz * 2.0) + (v_color.yz - 0.5) * 2.0;\n" +
216                        "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sRGB(clamp(lab2rgb(lab), 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
217                        "}";
218        ShaderProgram shader = new ShaderProgram(vertexShader, fragmentShader);
219        if (!shader.isCompiled()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Error compiling shader: " + shader.getLog());
220        return shader;
221    }
222
223    @Override
224    public void begin () {
225        if (drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.end must be called before begin.");
226        renderCalls = 0;
227
228        Gdx.gl.glDepthMask(false);
229        if (customShader != null)
230            customShader.bind();
231        else
232            shader.bind();
233        setupMatrices();
234
235        drawing = true;
236    }
237
238    @Override
239    public void end () {
240        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before end.");
241        if (idx > 0) flush();
242        lastTexture = null;
243        drawing = false;
244
245        GL20 gl = Gdx.gl;
246        gl.glDepthMask(true);
247        if (isBlendingEnabled()) gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
248    }
249
250    @Override
251    public void setColor (Color tint) {
252        color = tint.toFloatBits();
253    }
254
255    /**
256     * Sets the color to the result of {@link ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)} on the same arguments.
257     * For the L/A/B parameters, 0.5f is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 1.0f is a neutral
258     * value. For L/A/B, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
259     * @see ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)
260     * @param L like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
261     * @param A cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
262     * @param B artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
263     * @param alpha opacity, from 0 to 1; multiplicative
264     */
265    @Override
266    public void setColor (float L, float A, float B, float alpha) {
267        color = ColorTools.cielab(L, A, B, alpha);
268    }
269
270    public void setColor (final float color) {
271        setPackedColor(color);
272    }
273
274    public void setIntColor(final int color) {
275        this.color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(color & -2));
276    }
277
278    /**
279     * Sets the color with the given L/A/B and A parameters from 0 to 255.
280     * For the L/A/B parameters, 127 or 128 is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 255 is a neutral
281     * value. For L/A/B, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
282     * @see ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)
283     * @param L like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 255 (white)
284     * @param A cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 255 (orange/red/purple)
285     * @param B artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 255 (green/yellow/orange)
286     * @param alpha opacity, from 0 to 255 (254 is equivalent, since the lowest bit is discarded); multiplicative
287     */
288    public void setIntColor(int L, int A, int B, int alpha) {
289        color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((alpha << 24 & 0xFE000000)
290                | (B << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (A << 8 & 0xFF00) | (L & 0xFF));
291    }
292
293    @Override
294    public void setPackedColor (final float color) {
295        this.color = color;
296    }
297
298    @Override
299    public Color getColor () {
300        final int intBits = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(color);
301        Color color = tempColor;
302        color.r = (intBits & 0xff) / 255f;
303        color.g = ((intBits >>> 8) & 0xff) / 255f;
304        color.b = ((intBits >>> 16) & 0xff) / 255f;
305        color.a = ((intBits >>> 24) & 0xff) / 255f;
306        return color;
307    }
308
309    @Override
310    public float getPackedColor () {
311        return color;
312    }
313
314    /**
315     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 0.5 is a neutral value that should have
316     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f)} will effectively remove the tweak.
317     * @param L like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (sets lightness to 0) to 1 (doubles lightness)
318     * @param A cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green and red are removed) to 1 (green-ness or red-ness is emphasized)
319     * @param B artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue and yellow are removed) to 1 (blue-ness or yellow-ness is emphasized)
320     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes; ranges from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 1 (high contrast, sharpened look) 
321     */
322    public void setTweak (float L, float A, float B, float contrast) {
323        tweak = ColorTools.cielab(L, A, B, contrast);
324    }
325    /**
326     * Sets the tweak using a single packed CIELAB float.
327     * @see #setTweak(float, float, float, float)
328     * @param tweak a packed CIELAB float, with contrast instead of alpha
329     */
330    public void setTweak (final float tweak) {
331        this.tweak = tweak;
332    }
333    
334    public float getTweak () {
335        return tweak;
336    }
337
338    /**
339     * Takes the tweak as an int in the format: L (8 bits), A (8 bits), B (8 bits), contrast (7 bits),
340     * (1 ignored bit at the end). An example would be 0x7820206E, which slightly darkens (with L 0x78, slightly
341     * below the halfway point of 0x80), significantly reduces colorfulness with A and B multipliers of 0x20
342     * (closer to 0, so most colors will be almost grayscale), and slightly reduces contrast (with contrast and the
343     * ignored bit as 0x6E, which is less than the halfway point).
344     * @param tweak the tweak to use as an integer, with L in the most significant bits and contrast in least
345     */
346    public void setIntTweak(final int tweak) {
347        this.tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(tweak & -2));
348    }
349
350    /**
351     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 127 is a neutral value that should have
352     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (127, 127, 127, 127)} will effectively remove the tweak.
353     * @param L like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (black) to 255 (white)
354     * @param A cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green and red are removed) to 255 (green-ness or red-ness is emphasized)
355     * @param B artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue and yellow are removed) to 255 (blue-ness or yellow-ness is emphasized)
356     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes; ranges from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 255 (high contrast, sharpened look) 
357     */
358    public void setIntTweak(int L, int A, int B, int contrast) {
359        tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((contrast << 24 & 0xFE000000)
360                | (B << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (A << 8 & 0xFF00) | (L & 0xFF));
361    }
362
363    /**
364     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float)}) and the tweak (with
365     * {@link #setTweak(float)}) at the same time, using two packed floats.
366     * @param color the additive components and alpha, as a packed float
367     * @param tweak the multiplicative components and contrast, as a packed float
368     */
369    public void setTweakedColor(final float color, final float tweak) {
370        setColor(color);
371        setTweak(tweak);
372    }
373
374    /**
375     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float, float, float, float)}) and the tweak
376     * (with {@link #setTweak(float, float, float, float)}) at the same time.
377     * @param addL like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
378     * @param addA cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
379     * @param addB artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
380     * @param mulAlpha opacity, from 0 to 1; multiplicative
381     * @param mulL like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (sets all L to 0) to 1 (doubles the image's L)
382     * @param mulA cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
383     * @param mulB artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
384     * @param contrast foggy-to-sharp lightness contrast; affects most other components; ranges from 0 (flat, foggy lightness) to 1 (sharp, crisp lightness)
385     */
386    public void setTweakedColor(final float addL, final float addA,
387                                final float addB, final float mulAlpha,
388                                final float mulL, final float mulA,
389                                final float mulB, final float contrast) {
390        setColor(addL, addA, addB, mulAlpha);
391        setTweak(mulL, mulA, mulB, contrast);
392    }
393
394    @Override
395    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height, float scaleX,
396                      float scaleY, float rotation, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
397        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
398
399        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
400
401        if (texture != lastTexture)
402            switchTexture(texture);
403        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
404            flush();
405
406        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
407        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
408        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
409        float fx = -originX;
410        float fy = -originY;
411        float fx2 = width - originX;
412        float fy2 = height - originY;
413
414        // scale
415        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
416            fx *= scaleX;
417            fy *= scaleY;
418            fx2 *= scaleX;
419            fy2 *= scaleY;
420        }
421
422        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
423        final float p1x = fx;
424        final float p1y = fy;
425        final float p2x = fx;
426        final float p2y = fy2;
427        final float p3x = fx2;
428        final float p3y = fy2;
429        final float p4x = fx2;
430        final float p4y = fy;
431
432        float x1;
433        float y1;
434        float x2;
435        float y2;
436        float x3;
437        float y3;
438        float x4;
439        float y4;
440
441        // rotate
442        if (rotation != 0) {
443            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
444            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
445
446            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
447            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
448
449            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
450            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
451
452            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
453            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
454
455            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
456            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
457        } else {
458            x1 = p1x;
459            y1 = p1y;
460
461            x2 = p2x;
462            y2 = p2y;
463
464            x3 = p3x;
465            y3 = p3y;
466
467            x4 = p4x;
468            y4 = p4y;
469        }
470
471        x1 += worldOriginX;
472        y1 += worldOriginY;
473        x2 += worldOriginX;
474        y2 += worldOriginY;
475        x3 += worldOriginX;
476        y3 += worldOriginY;
477        x4 += worldOriginX;
478        y4 += worldOriginY;
479
480        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
481        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
482        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
483        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
484
485        if (flipX) {
486            float tmp = u;
487            u = u2;
488            u2 = tmp;
489        }
490
491        if (flipY) {
492            float tmp = v;
493            v = v2;
494            v2 = tmp;
495        }
496
497        final float color = this.color;
498        final float tweak = this.tweak;
499        final int idx = this.idx;
500        vertices[idx] = x1;
501        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
502        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
503        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
504        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
505        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
506
507        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
508        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
509        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
510        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
511        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
512        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
513
514        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
515        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
516        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
517        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
518        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
519        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
520
521        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
522        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
523        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
524        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
525        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
526        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
527        this.idx = idx + 24;
528    }
529
530    @Override
531    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth,
532                      int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
533        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
534
535        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
536
537        if (texture != lastTexture)
538            switchTexture(texture);
539        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
540            flush();
541
542        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
543        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
544        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
545        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
546        final float fx2 = x + width;
547        final float fy2 = y + height;
548
549        if (flipX) {
550            float tmp = u;
551            u = u2;
552            u2 = tmp;
553        }
554
555        if (flipY) {
556            float tmp = v;
557            v = v2;
558            v2 = tmp;
559        }
560
561        final float color = this.color;
562        final float tweak = this.tweak;
563        final int idx = this.idx;
564        vertices[idx] = x;
565        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
566        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
567        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
568        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
569        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
570
571        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
572        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
573        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
574        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
575        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
576        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
577
578        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
579        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
580        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
581        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
582        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
583        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
584
585        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
586        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
587        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
588        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
589        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
590        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
591        this.idx = idx + 24;
592    }
593
594    @Override
595    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight) {
596        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
597
598        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
599
600        if (texture != lastTexture)
601            switchTexture(texture);
602        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
603            flush();
604
605        final float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
606        final float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
607        final float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
608        final float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
609        final float fx2 = x + srcWidth;
610        final float fy2 = y + srcHeight;
611
612        final float color = this.color;
613        final float tweak = this.tweak;

628
629        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
630        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
631        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
632        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
633        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;

637        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
638        vertices[idx + 20] = color;

640        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
641        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
642        this.idx = idx + 24;
643    }

660        final float tweak = this.tweak;

696
697    @Override
698    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
699        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
700
701        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
702
703        if (texture != lastTexture)
704            switchTexture(texture);
705        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
706            flush();
707
708        final float fx2 = x + width;
709        final float fy2 = y + height;
710        final float u = 0;
711        final float v = 1;
712        final float u2 = 1;
713        final float v2 = 0;
714
715        final float color = this.color;
716        final float tweak = this.tweak;
717        final int idx = this.idx;
718        vertices[idx] = x;
719        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
720        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
721        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
722        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
723        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
724
725        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
726        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
727        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
728        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
729        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
730        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
731
732        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
733        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
734        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
735        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
736        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
737        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
738
739        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
740        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
741        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
742        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
743        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
744        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
745        this.idx = idx + 24;
746    }
747
748    /**
749     * This is very different from the other overloads in this class; it assumes the float array it is given is in the
750     * format libGDX uses to give to SpriteBatch, that is, in groups of 20 floats per sprite. ColorfulBatch uses 24
751     * floats per sprite, to add tweak per color, so this does some conversion.
752     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
753     * @param spriteVertices not the same format as {@link #vertices} in this class; should have a length that's a multiple of 20
754     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
755     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (20 vertices is one sprite)
756     */
757    @Override
758    public void draw (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
759        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
760
761        count = (count / 5) * 6;
762        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
763        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
764        if (texture != lastTexture)
765            switchTexture(texture);
766        else {
767            remainingVertices -= idx;
768            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
769                flush();
770                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
771            }
772        }
773        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
774        final float tweak = this.tweak;
775
776        ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
777        //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
778        ////new way, thanks mgsx
779        for (int s = offset, v = idx, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
780            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
781            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
782            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
783            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
784            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
785            vertices[v++] = tweak;
786        }
787        idx += copyCount;
788        count -= copyCount;
789        while (count > 0) {
790            offset += (copyCount / 6) * 5;
791            flush();
792            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
793            ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
794            //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
795            ////new way, thanks mgsx
796            for (int s = offset, v = 0, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
797                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
798                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
799                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
800                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
801                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
802                vertices[v++] = tweak;
803            }
804            idx += copyCount;
805            count -= copyCount;
806        }
807    }
808
809    /**
810     * Meant for code that uses ColorfulBatch specifically and can set an extra float (for the color tweak) per vertex,
811     * this is just like {@link #draw(Texture, float[], int, int)} when used in other Batch implementations, but expects
812     * {@code spriteVertices} to have a length that is a multiple of 24 instead of 20.
813     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
814     * @param spriteVertices vertices formatted as this class uses them; length should be a multiple of 24
815     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
816     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (24 vertices is one sprite)
817     */
818    public void drawExactly (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
819        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
820
821        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
822        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
823        if (texture != lastTexture)
824            switchTexture(texture);
825        else {
826            remainingVertices -= idx;
827            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
828                flush();
829                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
830            }
831        }
832        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
833
834        System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
835        idx += copyCount;
836        count -= copyCount;
837        while (count > 0) {
838            offset += copyCount;
839            flush();
840            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
841            System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
842            idx += copyCount;
843            count -= copyCount;
844        }
845    }
846
847    @Override
848    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y) {
849        draw(region, x, y, region.getRegionWidth(), region.getRegionHeight());
850    }
851
852    @Override
853    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
854        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
855
856        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
857
858        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
859        if (texture != lastTexture) {
860            switchTexture(texture);
861        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
862            flush();
863        }
864        final float fx2 = x + width;
865        final float fy2 = y + height;
866        final float u = region.getU();
867        final float v = region.getV2();
868        final float u2 = region.getU2();
869        final float v2 = region.getV();
870
871        final float color = this.color;
872        final float tweak = this.tweak;
873        final int idx = this.idx;
874        vertices[idx] = x;
875        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
876        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
877        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
878        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
879        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
880
881        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
882        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
883        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
884        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
885        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
886        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
887
888        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
889        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
890        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
891        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
892        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
893        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
894
895        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
896        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
897        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
898        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
899        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
900        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
901        this.idx = idx + 24;
902    }
903
904    @Override
905    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
906                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation) {
907        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
908
909        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
910
911        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
912        if (texture != lastTexture) {
913            switchTexture(texture);
914        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
915            flush();
916
917        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
918        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
919        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
920        float fx = -originX;
921        float fy = -originY;
922        float fx2 = width - originX;
923        float fy2 = height - originY;
924
925        // scale
926        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
927            fx *= scaleX;
928            fy *= scaleY;
929            fx2 *= scaleX;
930            fy2 *= scaleY;
931        }
932
933        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
934        final float p1x = fx;
935        final float p1y = fy;
936        final float p2x = fx;
937        final float p2y = fy2;
938        final float p3x = fx2;
939        final float p3y = fy2;
940        final float p4x = fx2;
941        final float p4y = fy;
942
943        float x1;
944        float y1;
945        float x2;
946        float y2;
947        float x3;
948        float y3;
949        float x4;
950        float y4;
951
952        // rotate
953        if (rotation != 0) {
954            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
955            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
956
957            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
958            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
959
960            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
961            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
962
963            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
964            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
965
966            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
967            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
968        } else {
969            x1 = p1x;
970            y1 = p1y;
971
972            x2 = p2x;
973            y2 = p2y;
974
975            x3 = p3x;
976            y3 = p3y;
977
978            x4 = p4x;
979            y4 = p4y;
980        }
981
982        x1 += worldOriginX;
983        y1 += worldOriginY;
984        x2 += worldOriginX;
985        y2 += worldOriginY;
986        x3 += worldOriginX;
987        y3 += worldOriginY;
988        x4 += worldOriginX;
989        y4 += worldOriginY;
990
991        final float u = region.getU();
992        final float v = region.getV2();
993        final float u2 = region.getU2();
994        final float v2 = region.getV();
995
996        final float color = this.color;
997        final float tweak = this.tweak;
998        final int idx = this.idx;
999        vertices[idx] = x1;
1000        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1001        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1002        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1003        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1004        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1005
1006        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1007        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1008        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1009        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1010        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1011        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1012
1013        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1014        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1015        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1016        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1017        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1018        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1019
1020        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1021        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1022        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1023        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1024        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1025        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1026        this.idx = idx + 24;
1027    }
1028
1029    @Override
1030    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
1031                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation, boolean clockwise) {
1032        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1033
1034        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1035
1036        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1037        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1038            switchTexture(texture);
1039        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
1040            flush();
1041
1042        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
1043        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
1044        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
1045        float fx = -originX;
1046        float fy = -originY;
1047        float fx2 = width - originX;
1048        float fy2 = height - originY;
1049
1050        // scale
1051        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
1052            fx *= scaleX;
1053            fy *= scaleY;
1054            fx2 *= scaleX;
1055            fy2 *= scaleY;
1056        }
1057
1058        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
1059        final float p1x = fx;
1060        final float p1y = fy;
1061        final float p2x = fx;
1062        final float p2y = fy2;
1063        final float p3x = fx2;
1064        final float p3y = fy2;
1065        final float p4x = fx2;
1066        final float p4y = fy;
1067
1068        float x1;
1069        float y1;
1070        float x2;
1071        float y2;
1072        float x3;
1073        float y3;
1074        float x4;
1075        float y4;
1076
1077        // rotate
1078        if (rotation != 0) {
1079            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
1080            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
1081
1082            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
1083            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
1084
1085            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
1086            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
1087
1088            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
1089            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
1090
1091            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
1092            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
1093        } else {
1094            x1 = p1x;
1095            y1 = p1y;
1096
1097            x2 = p2x;
1098            y2 = p2y;
1099
1100            x3 = p3x;
1101            y3 = p3y;
1102
1103            x4 = p4x;
1104            y4 = p4y;
1105        }
1106
1107        x1 += worldOriginX;
1108        y1 += worldOriginY;
1109        x2 += worldOriginX;
1110        y2 += worldOriginY;
1111        x3 += worldOriginX;
1112        y3 += worldOriginY;
1113        x4 += worldOriginX;
1114        y4 += worldOriginY;
1115
1116        float u1, v1, u2, v2, u3, v3, u4, v4;
1117        if (clockwise) {
1118            u1 = region.getU2();
1119            v1 = region.getV2();
1120            u2 = region.getU();
1121            v2 = region.getV2();
1122            u3 = region.getU();
1123            v3 = region.getV();
1124            u4 = region.getU2();
1125            v4 = region.getV();
1126        } else {
1127            u1 = region.getU();
1128            v1 = region.getV();
1129            u2 = region.getU2();
1130            v2 = region.getV();
1131            u3 = region.getU2();
1132            v3 = region.getV2();
1133            u4 = region.getU();
1134            v4 = region.getV2();
1135        }
1136
1137        final float color = this.color;
1138        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1139        final int idx = this.idx;
1140        vertices[idx] = x1;
1141        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1142        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1143        vertices[idx + 3] = u1;
1144        vertices[idx + 4] = v1;
1145        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1146
1147        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1148        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1149        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1150        vertices[idx + 9] = u2;
1151        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1152        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1153
1154        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1155        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1156        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1157        vertices[idx + 15] = u3;
1158        vertices[idx + 16] = v3;
1159        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1160
1161        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1162        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1163        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1164        vertices[idx + 21] = u4;
1165        vertices[idx + 22] = v4;
1166        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1167        this.idx = idx + 24;
1168    }
1169
1170    @Override
1171    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float width, float height, Affine2 transform) {
1172        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1173
1174        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1175
1176        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1177        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1178            switchTexture(texture);
1179        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
1180            flush();
1181        }
1182
1183        // construct corner points
1184        float x1 = transform.m02;
1185        float y1 = transform.m12;
1186        float x2 = transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1187        float y2 = transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1188        float x3 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1189        float y3 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1190        float x4 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m02;
1191        float y4 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m12;
1192
1193        float u = region.getU();
1194        float v = region.getV2();
1195        float u2 = region.getV2();
1196        float v2 = region.getV();
1197
1198        final float color = this.color;
1199        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1200        final int idx = this.idx;
1201        vertices[idx] = x1;
1202        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1203        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1204        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1205        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1206        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1207
1208        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1209        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1210        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1211        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1212        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1213        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1214
1215        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1216        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1217        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1218        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1219        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1220        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1221
1222        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1223        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1224        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1225        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1226        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1227        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1228        this.idx = idx + 24;
1229    }
1230
1231    @SuppressWarnings("RedundantCast") // These casts are absolutely not redundant! Java 9 changed Buffer ABI.
1232    @Override
1233    public void flush () {
1234        if (idx == 0) return;
1235
1236        renderCalls++;
1237        totalRenderCalls++;
1238        int spritesInBatch = idx / SPRITE_SIZE;
1239        if (spritesInBatch > maxSpritesInBatch) maxSpritesInBatch = spritesInBatch;
1240        int count = spritesInBatch * 6;
1241
1242        lastTexture.bind();
1243        Mesh mesh = this.mesh;
1244        mesh.setVertices(vertices, 0, idx);
1245        ((Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer()).position(0);
1246        ((Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer()).limit(count);
1247
1248        if (blendingDisabled) {
1249            Gdx.gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1250        } else {
1251            Gdx.gl.glEnable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1252            if (blendSrcFunc != -1) Gdx.gl.glBlendFuncSeparate(blendSrcFunc, blendDstFunc, blendSrcFuncAlpha, blendDstFuncAlpha);
1253        }
1254
1255        mesh.render(customShader != null ? customShader : shader, GL20.GL_TRIANGLES, 0, count);
1256
1257        idx = 0;
1258    }
1259
1260    @Override
1261    public void disableBlending () {
1262        if (blendingDisabled) return;
1263        flush();
1264        blendingDisabled = true;
1265    }
1266
1267    @Override
1268    public void enableBlending () {
1269        if (!blendingDisabled) return;
1270        flush();
1271        blendingDisabled = false;
1272    }
1273
1274    @Override
1275    public void setBlendFunction (int srcFunc, int dstFunc) {
1276        setBlendFunctionSeparate(srcFunc, dstFunc, srcFunc, dstFunc);
1277    }
1278
1279    @Override
1280    public void setBlendFunctionSeparate(int srcFuncColor, int dstFuncColor, int srcFuncAlpha, int dstFuncAlpha) {
1281        if (blendSrcFunc == srcFuncColor && blendDstFunc == dstFuncColor && blendSrcFuncAlpha == srcFuncAlpha && blendDstFuncAlpha == dstFuncAlpha) return;
1282        flush();
1283        blendSrcFunc = srcFuncColor;
1284        blendDstFunc = dstFuncColor;
1285        blendSrcFuncAlpha = srcFuncAlpha;
1286        blendDstFuncAlpha = dstFuncAlpha;
1287    }
1288
1289    @Override
1290    public int getBlendSrcFunc () {
1291        return blendSrcFunc;
1292    }
1293
1294    @Override
1295    public int getBlendDstFunc () {
1296        return blendDstFunc;
1297    }
1298
1299    @Override
1300    public int getBlendSrcFuncAlpha() {
1301        return blendSrcFuncAlpha;
1302    }
1303
1304    @Override
1305    public int getBlendDstFuncAlpha() {
1306        return blendDstFuncAlpha;
1307    }
1308
1309    @Override
1310    public void dispose () {
1311        mesh.dispose();
1312        if (ownsShader && shader != null) shader.dispose();
1313    }
1314
1315    @Override
1316    public Matrix4 getProjectionMatrix () {
1317        return projectionMatrix;
1318    }
1319
1320    @Override
1321    public Matrix4 getTransformMatrix () {
1322        return transformMatrix;
1323    }
1324
1325    @Override
1326    public void setProjectionMatrix (Matrix4 projection) {
1327        if (drawing) flush();
1328        projectionMatrix.set(projection);
1329        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1330    }
1331
1332    @Override
1333    public void setTransformMatrix (Matrix4 transform) {
1334        if (drawing) flush();
1335        transformMatrix.set(transform);
1336        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1337    }
1338
1339    protected void setupMatrices () {
1340        combinedMatrix.set(projectionMatrix).mul(transformMatrix);
1341        if (customShader != null) {
1342            customShader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1343            customShader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1344        } else {
1345            shader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1346            shader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1347        }
1348    }
1349
1350    protected void switchTexture (Texture texture) {
1351        flush();
1352        lastTexture = texture;
1353        invTexWidth = 1.0f / texture.getWidth();
1354        invTexHeight = 1.0f / texture.getHeight();
1355    }
1356
1357    @Override
1358    public void setShader (ShaderProgram shader) {
1359        if (drawing) {
1360            flush();
1361        }
1362        customShader = shader;
1363        if (drawing) {
1364            if (customShader != null)
1365                customShader.bind();
1366            else
1367                this.shader.bind();
1368            setupMatrices();
1369        }
1370    }
1371
1372    @Override
1373    public ShaderProgram getShader () {
1374        if (customShader == null) {
1375            return shader;
1376        }
1377        return customShader;
1378    }
1379
1380    @Override
1381    public boolean isBlendingEnabled () {
1382        return !blendingDisabled;
1383    }
1384
1385    public boolean isDrawing () {
1386        return drawing;
1387    }
1388    static public final int X1 = 0;
1389    static public final int Y1 = 1;
1390    static public final int C1 = 2;
1391    static public final int U1 = 3;
1392    static public final int V1 = 4;
1393    static public final int T1 = 5;
1394    static public final int X2 = 6;
1395    static public final int Y2 = 7;
1396    static public final int C2 = 8;
1397    static public final int U2 = 9;
1398    static public final int V2 = 10;
1399    static public final int T2 = 11;
1400    static public final int X3 = 12;
1401    static public final int Y3 = 13;
1402    static public final int C3 = 14;
1403    static public final int U3 = 15;
1404    static public final int V3 = 16;
1405    static public final int T3 = 17;
1406    static public final int X4 = 18;
1407    static public final int Y4 = 19;
1408    static public final int C4 = 20;
1409    static public final int U4 = 21;
1410    static public final int V4 = 22;
1411    static public final int T4 = 23;
1412}
